sources.full: Tera's Travels At the Peaks of Gravity

book.name: Tera's Travels At the Peaks of Gravity
book.author: InxSinon

entries.name: Tera's Travels
entries: Тера - картограф, путешествующий по миру и наносящий на карту уникальные места, которые иначе могли бы остаться неизвестными. В своих путешествиях она регулярно находит народы, существ и магию, еще не зафиксированные другими. Сегодня она решила рассказать о некоторых находках из своего последнего путешествия - о горном массиве, известном как Пики Гравитации.

Горный хребет Пики Гравитации выпирает из земли, как будто созданный не физическим явлением. Вершины гор представляют собой острые пики, которые видны на многие мили, но сильная гравитационная энергия не позволяет всем, кроме немногих, подняться на них. Некоторые считают, что много веков назад мощные гравитационные волны прошли через эту местность и изменили ее естественное поведение, создав горный хребет и оставив после себя долговременную магическую энергию. Другие, более тесно связанные с землей, говорят, что это гораздо более естественно и просто проявление сил природы.
Как бы то ни было, у этого горного массива и народов, которые называют его своим домом, есть много отличительных качеств.

entries.name: Thrush
entries: Расу, представленную в этом разделе, можно просмотреть {@race Thrush|TTAtPoG|here}.

rows: На 2-м уровне друид получает способность "Круг друидов". {@class Druid|PHB|Circle of Gravitation|Gravitation|TTAtPoG} - это дополнительная возможность, которую друид может выбрать.

entries.name: Fighter
entries: На 3-м уровне боец получает свойство "Боевой архетип". {@class Fighter|PHB|Gravity Knight|Gravity Knight|TTtPoG} - это дополнительная возможность, которую боец может выбрать.

Бойцы, которых я встречал, называющие себя гравитационными рыцарями, сильны, мудры и уверены в своих действиях. Хотя они не совсем заклинатели, они обладают способностями к легкой гравитационной магии и используют ее уникальным образом в сочетании с боевой тактикой.

entries.name: Monk
entries: На 3-м уровне монах получает свойство "Монашеская традиция". {@class Monk|PHB|Way of Gravitation|Gravitation|TTAtPoG} - это дополнительная возможность, которую монах может выбрать.

entries.name: Sorcerer
entries: На 1-м уровне колдун получает свойство колдовского происхождения. {@class Sorcerer|PHB|Gravitational Origin|Gravitational|TTAtPoG} - это дополнительная возможность, которую колдун может выбрать.

Я не встречал колдунов, которые бы так хорошо владели гравитационной магией. Но те, кого я встречал, демонстрировали большой контроль над силой природы, огибая ее вокруг себя, управляя другими и произнося заклинания, о которых врожденные мастера могли только мечтать.

entries.name: Wizard
entries: На 2-м уровне волшебник получает свойство традиции арканов. {@class Wizard|PHB|School of Gravity|Gravity|TTAtPoG} - это дополнительная возможность, которую волшебник может выбрать.

Путешествуя по Пикам Гравитации, я встретил нескольких студентов-магов, сосредоточивших свои исследования на гравитационных силах. Их преданность своему ремеслу позволяет им получить доступ к магии, обычно доступной только тем, кто более естественно связан с силами природы.

entries.name: Backgrounds
entries: У жителей Пиков Гравитации может быть любая биография, хотя для тех, кто имеет более личную связь с этим местом, доступна следующая биография.

entries.name: Feats
entries: Некоторые ГМы разрешают использовать подвиги. В этом разделе представлены два новых подвига, доступных для выражения возможностей персонажа, если вы используете правило опций.

Пики Гравитации - одно из самых больших и уникальных мест, которые я еще не нанес на карту. Основные тропы, проходящие через нижний регион, хорошо известны, так как путешественники и торговцы используют их, чтобы избежать путешествия по всему хребту. Однако даже в этом случае для неподготовленных людей они могут оказаться опасными, и чем выше вы поднимаетесь, тем опаснее становится путь.
Я знаю только один цивилизованный город на всех пиках притяжения - деревню на вершине Риги.
Ниже я описал некоторые основные моменты, представляющие интерес и часто встречающиеся.

entries.name: High Altitude Conditions
entries: Пики Гравитации испытывают постоянную гравитационную энергию, которая насыщает весь регион. Этот энергетический колодец обладает уникальными магическими свойствами и значительно затрудняет передвижение.
Следующие условия присутствуют на высоте не менее той, что отмечена в колонке "Высота".

rows: Путешествуя в быстром темпе, существо рассматривает каждый час пути как 2 часа пути для целей определения {@condition exhaustion}, как указано в правиле "Темп движения".
Грузоподъемность существа уменьшается до 10-кратного показателя силы.
Скорость магического полета уменьшается вдвое.

entries.name: The Crooked Cave
entries: Кривая бухта - это прозвище входа на главную тропу с запада. Она образована естественным образом возникающим стыком между основаниями двух гор, которые встречаются на высоте около 30 футов над землей, создавая пещерообразный путь между горами и под ними.

Почти сразу же тропа начинает делать быстрые резкие повороты и круто подниматься вверх, пока примерно через полмили не достигнет внешней тропы. Этот путь относительно безопасен, хотя {@creature goblin|mm|goblins} и другие существа иногда устраивают засады, молясь на путешественников, которые не могут полагаться на {@sense darkvision} зрение.

широкий вход ведет в крутой туннель, похожий на пещеру, который змеится и поворачивает под горами. Жесткие естественные стены и потолок покрыты легким конденсатом. Свет не проникает в туннель более чем на несколько метров.

entries.name: Heavy Foothills
entries: Извилистая бухта выходит примерно через полмили и 500 футов вверх по хребту к главной тропе, известной как "тяжелые предгорья". Здесь есть немного наезженная грунтовая дорога, достаточно широкая для одной небольшой телеги или повозки.
Проверка DC 12 {@skill Perception} покажет, что здесь нет следов ног или следов от телеги, а любой след, оставленный в грязи, быстро сглаживается, так как гравитация прижимает рыхлую землю вниз.

Тяжелая сила тяжести давит на вас, когда вы выходите из пещеры к подножию пиков гравитации. Небольшая грунтовая дорожка начинается впереди и медленно петляет между основаниями десятков суровых массивных гор. Не видно никакой растительности, кроме небольших участков сухой травы и мха.

На протяжении всего пути часто встречаются интересные места на склоне граничащих гор, например, птичье гнездо или выброшенный крюк для захвата, застрявший в скале. Существо, пытающееся взобраться на склон горы, должно успешно выполнить проверку DC 15 {@skill Athletics} в начале каждого своего хода или не сможет взобраться до начала своего следующего хода. Если оно проваливает бросок на 5 или более баллов, оно также падает вниз на 20 футов.

Большинство знаков и табличек здесь не сохранилось из-за суровых условий, но есть одна большая бронзовая статуя гуманоида, указывающая вверх и на север, на полпути между западной и восточной сторонами горного хребта. Примерно в 100 футах от тропы есть крутой склон скалы с заметными опорами, который следует в направлении, указанном статуей. Это начало пути к Риджи и начало реальных опасностей, которые встречаются на этом пути.

entries.name: First Hill To Rigi
entries: Высота склона составляет 80 футов, он расположен почти под углом 90 градусов, и по нему можно подняться только на ширину 40 футов. Существо, поднимающееся по тропе, должно сделать проверку DC 15 {@skill Athletics} каждый ход, когда оно пытается подняться выше. При успехе оно движется со своей скоростью подъема в течение этого хода. В случае неудачи существо движется только с половиной своей возможной скорости подъема за ход. Если существо проваливается на 5 или более очков, оно теряет все свое движение на этот ход и падает вниз на 10 футов.
DC для подъема по тропе может меняться в зависимости от текущих условий на горе. Оно может колебаться от 10 до 20.

Нередко {@creature goblin|mm|goblins} или {@creature bandit|mm|bandits} устраивают засады на вершине холма. При такой встрече засадники могут использовать {@item grappling hook|PHB|grappling hooks}, {@filter ranged weapons|items|type=Ranged Weapon} и элемент неожиданности, чтобы одержать верх.

entries.name: The Wide Range
entries: По словам местных жителей, живущих в Риги, все, что находится между первым холмом Риги и самим городом, известно как широкий хребет. По нему ходят почти исключительно монстры {@creature bandit|mm|bandits}, самоуверенные путешественники и искатели приключений. Иногда встречаются те, кто изучает или иным образом связан с гравитационной энергией, которая может быть найдена живущими или проходящими через широкий хребет.

Широкий хребет включает в себя десятки гор с вершинами от чуть более 9 000 футов до более 20 000. Самая высокая вершина - Риги - находится на высоте 24 042 фута над землей. Не существует единого безопасного пути к Риги, и его прохождение зависит от выживания и постоянного стремления к самым высоким точкам. Группа, идущая в нормальном темпе, может рассчитывать на несколько дней пути по горам, прежде чем достигнет Риги.

entries.name: Broken Valley
entries: Несколько больших гор соединяются и образуют нечто похожее на долину из грязи и песка, окруженную скалистыми горными вершинами высотой всего 20-60 футов. Это известное место для разумных существ, таких как {@creature adult gravity dragon|TTAtPoG|gravity dragons}, чтобы затаиться и напасть на отдыхающих путников.

entries.name: Crest of Stone
entries: Одна гора в широком диапазоне выделяется совершенно плоской скалистой вершиной. Гора заполнена лабиринтом туннелей, вырытых искателями приключений, которые пытались создать безопасный дом на вершинах. Со временем туннели были захвачены {@creature bandit|mm|bandits} и теми, кто с дурными намерениями искал укрытия.

Туннели медленно поднимаются вверх, но теперь они изобилуют ловушками и тупиками, которые могут запереть вас за решеткой. Здешние жители {@creature bandit|mm|bandits} быстро идут на сделку и отпускают заключенных в обмен на предметы и золото. Они не спешат нападать, если их не спровоцировать. Хотя у них есть по крайней мере один маг, который специализируется на гравитационной магии и без колебаний применит ее против угрозы.

Если удастся пробиться через туннели, пробраться или убедить их, то в конце концов они выведут на вершину скалистой горы. С этой плоской вершины открывается прекрасный вид на ветряной хребет, и это отличная точка прыжка для тех, у кого есть доступ к {@spell fly} или подобному заклинанию.

entries.name: Summit Village of Rigi
entries: Риги - скромная по размерам деревня на самой высокой вершине Пиков Гравитации. Это дом для многих различных народов и рас, которые оказались там. Из-за своего уединенного расположения Риги имеет собственное культурное общество и способы процветания. Однако они все еще используют золото для торговли, так как через них часто проходят путешественники.

entries.name: Overview
entries: Все здания здесь плоские, одноэтажные, так как огромная сила тяжести опрокинет высокие строения без особых укреплений. Земля также ровная, покрытая песчаной грязью, по всей деревне уложены тяжелые булыжники, создающие простые пешеходные дорожки. Здесь очень мало повозок и нет ни одного грузного животного, которое бы регулярно использовалось. Если такое существо попадает сюда с помощью магии, то на это обращают внимание.

В Риги есть определенные места растительности, которые подпитываются кристаллом {@spell plant growth}. Кристалл находится в главном правительственном здании Риги и является священным предметом для жителей деревни. Его выносят только раз в год на праздник урожая, чтобы запустить рост растений на следующий год. Такие магические средства необходимы, чтобы вырастить достаточно еды для всего города.
За деревней расположено большое чистое озеро, в котором в изобилии водится рыба, хотя общественная рыбалка строго запрещена, так как популяция рыбы необходима для выживания и пропитания деревни.

Население считает, что в Риджи нет постоянного места для магических путешествий, но есть круг телепортации, расположенный в здании правительства, к которому имеют доступ или знают о нем только мэр Легисто и констебль Гербис.

entries.name: Locations of Interest
entries: Риги - это всего лишь скромная деревня, но в ней находится множество уникальных мест.

entries.name: Open Market
entries: Открытый рынок расположен в центре города. На нем находится общий магазин, а также множество постоянных уличных торговцев, которые продают и обменивают огромное количество продуктов, рыбы, изделий из дерева и наемных рабочих.

entries.name: Patrice's Potions
entries: Зелья Патриса - это небольшое старое деревянное здание, расположенное в стороне от открытого рынка. Его дверь и деревянные полы скрипят, когда его используют. Хозяйка, Патрис, - ярко-синяя и красная женщина-дрозд, живет в маленькой комнате в задней части здания, заполненной собранными ветками и безделушками, образующими большое гнездо. Патрис изготавливает свои собственные зелья и продает их с наценкой к обычной цене, даже местным жителям, а уж тем более чужакам. Ее запасы ограничены, но у нее всегда есть несколько зелий здоровья, если только недавно не проходили искатели приключений.

entries.name: Ol'Dingers
entries: Ol'Dinners - это местный бар, построенный из тяжелого камня и кирпича. Внутри он выкрашен в яркие цвета, а управляет им человек средних лет, называющий себя Ол'Диннер. За стойкой бара висит колокольчик, в который он громко звонит каждый раз, когда заказывают выпивку. Чем больше заказывают, тем больше он волнуется и тем громче звонит в колокольчик. Местный напиток он называет "дингер", который он старается продать всем клиентам, если они его еще не пробовали.

entries.name: Ono Heavy Bathhouse
entries: Баня Ono Heavy расположена на другом конце города от озера Саммит. Вода, используемая в бане, собирается из местной дождевой воды, и на ощупь она тяжелее обычной воды, что обеспечивает расслабляющий эффект.

entries.name: Trinkets and Travelers
entries: Trinkets and Travels - это небольшой уличный торговец, который продает случайные безделушки и предметы, выменянные или найденные в путешествиях. В основном все обыденное и по завышенной цене, но в редких случаях среди безделушек попадаются обычные магические предметы.

entries.name: Guard House
entries: Дом стражи - главное здание правоохранительных органов, в котором находится местная тюрьма. Им управляет констебль Гербис Шпрунк, крупный краснокожий драконорожденный мужчина. Он называет дом стражи сторожевой башней, хотя она всего лишь одноэтажная и из нее не открывается вид на деревню, как из любого другого здания.

entries.name: Government Building
entries: Здание правительства - самое большое здание в деревне. В нем живет мэр Легисто Мемлок. Здесь же находится единственный в Риджи транспортный круг, а также хранится священный кристалл роста растений деревни.

entries.name: Summit Lake
entries: За деревней находится большое чистое озеро с вершиной, в котором водится много рыбы. Общественная рыбалка строго запрещена, так как популяция рыбы необходима для выживания и пропитания деревни. Глубина озера в самой глубокой точке составляет около 100 футов.

entries.name: Pepper's Inn
entries: Гостиница Пеппера - единственная официальная гостиница, расположенная в Риджи. Он имеет скромные цены и состоит из 10 комнат, расположенных в одном длинном коридоре.

entries.name: Mayor Legisto Memloc
entries: Мэр Риги - небинарный эльф по имени Легисто Мемлок. Им более 300 сотен лет, и они утверждают, что всегда жили в Риджи. Часто они носят красочные одеяния, контрастирующие со скалистыми окрестностями, открыто гуляют по городу и живут в здании правительства. Прежде всего, Легисто стремятся сохранить Риги в безопасности и процветании. Они всегда будут действовать так, как, по их мнению, будет лучше для всей деревни.
Легисто не владеют магией, но ходят с {@item staff of gravity|TTAtPoG} и прячут {@item wand of weightlessness|TTAtPoG} в своих одеждах.
Они будут нанимать только тех авантюристов, которые уже доказали свою полезность для деревни.

entries.name: Constable Gerbis Shprunk
entries: Констебль Гребис Шпрунк - лидер стражи Риги. Это крупный мужчина красного драконорожденного цвета, который носит тяжелые обветренные доспехи. Он совсем не скромен и всегда готов похвастаться собой или стражей Риги. Он действует, чтобы защитить деревню, и не колеблясь прибегает к насилию, если это необходимо, хотя и убивает без необходимости. Местные жители знают, что у Гербиса есть опыт получения взяток в обмен на то, что он будет смотреть сквозь пальцы на мелкие преступления, но не на те, которые он считает опасными.
Скорее всего, он наймет приключенцев, которым доверяет, для ночного патрулирования деревни или для отслеживания преступлений за ее пределами.

entries.name: Fronica Baler
entries: Все в Риджи знают старую Фронику Балер, пожилую человеческую женщину, которая днем бродит по городу и живет в маленьком деревянном домике. Фроника практикует друидическую магию с упором на гравитационные заклинания, хотя мало кому удается увидеть, как она творит магию. Она слишком дружелюбна и всегда готова поделиться историями о своей жизни и временах, проведенных на вершинах.

Фроника нанимает авантюристов, с которыми она никогда раньше не встречалась. Задания, для которых она нанимается, могут включать поиск волшебных предметов, о которых она слышала, в пиках гравитации, уничтожение испорченных существ или даже посадку деревьев в опасных местах.

entries.name: Adventure Hooks
entries: Вы можете использовать следующую таблицу, чтобы придумать причину, по которой ваша партия будет путешествовать через Пики Гравитации.

rows: Исследование личности в области магии.
Купец нанял вас для доставки товаров в Риги.
Алхимику нужна кровь гравитационного дракона.
Поиск эзотерических знаний.
У вас есть член партии, который вырос в Риги.
Гордость от самостоятельного поиска Риги.

entries: Чтобы вдохновиться на приключения в Пиках Гравитации, можно воспользоваться таблицей ниже.

rows: Группе друидов нужна помощь в обеспечении безопасности их вершины.
Вы находите монаха, медитирующего на изолированной вершине.
Ваша партия попала в засаду горных бандитов.
Вы решили проследить за гравитационным драконом, летящим между вершинами.
Вы находите потерявшихся исследователей, которым нужна помощь, чтобы добраться до Риджи.
You are attacked by a {@creature gravity elemental|TTAtPoG}.

entries: You can use the following table for quests that could come up in the village of Rigi.

rows: Guard the perimeter of the village through the night.
Seek out bandits that stole from the village and are staying in the wide range.
Hired by thieves to steal the crystal of plant grown from the village.
Find an item lost by a villager in the peaks.
Hired to find gravity dragons hoard.
A {@creature magnet golem|TTAtPoG} has gotten loose in the village.
Investigate activity on a nearby peak.
Seek out gravitational spell scrolls.

entries.name: Battle Map

entries: Through the wide range and heavy foothills there is no shortage of dangerous locations, rocky thin paths, and side peaks with supposed treasures.

Below I have included a detailed map of a location that is just one example of the types of terrain you will find in the Peaks of Gravity. Encountering a gravity dragon perched on these slopes, or large group of mountain bandits would be especially dangerous.
Each square in the map below is 5 feet wide, and each slope is roughly 5-10 feet high at a steep incline.

data.name: Creatures

entries: Many new and unique creatures lurk throughout the Peaks of Gravity. Some of the most interesting creatures are listed here.
The creatures presented in this section can be found in the {@filter Bestiary|bestiary|source=TTAtPoG} page.

data.name: Magic Items
entries: This section introduces new magic items related to the Peaks of Gravity. The magic items are presented in alphabetical order in the {@filter Items|items|source=TTAtPoG} page.

entries.name: Gravitational Spell List
entries: The gravitational spell list comprises of spells that alter gravity, magnetism, and seismic energy. The following spells make up the gravitational spell list. Spells labeled with a "*" are new spells that can be found below. New spells are ordered by spell level.

spell.name: Fling
entries: You take control of the gravity of an object that is not being worn or carried you can see within range. You can move the object up to 30 feet within range, then you can choose to freeze the object's gravity until the start of your next turn. While an object has its gravity frozen this way, it remains still, and can't be moved by any means except teleportation.

spell.name: Magnetize
entries: You attempt to magnetically pull a metal object, or creature wearing or carrying metal you can see within range. If the target is an unwilling creature, it can make a Strength saving throw, avoiding the effects of this spell on a success.
Otherwise, the target is pulled a distance of your choosing up to 10 feet directly towards you.
The distance this spell can pull the target increases by 10 feet when you reach 5th level (20 feet), 11th level (30 feet), and
17th level (40 feet).

spell.name: Push/Pull
entries: One creature you can see within range must make a Strength saving throw, as you manipulate gravity around it. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d6} force damage and is pulled up to 5 feet directly towards you or away from you (your choice).
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Gravitational Flux
entries: You force a creature you can see within range to make a Strength saving throw. A willing creature can choose to fail this saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has its gravity changed to a direction of your choice, and is pulled a distance of your choosing up to 10 feet in that direction. Its gravity then returns to normal. If the creature hits a solid surface, other creature, or object of size Medium or larger during this movement, it takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was pulled, and falls {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the distance the target can be pulled increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 1st, up to a maximum of 50 feet.

spell.name: Intensify Gravity
entries: Choose a point within range. A 20-foot cube of intense gravity is created originating from that point. A creature in the cube must expend 2 feet of its movement for each foot it moves, and can't use a flying speed to move higher than its current location.
On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use a bonus action to move the cube up to 30 feet within range.

spell.name: Root

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you standing up form prone

entries: Choose one creature that is standing up from {@condition prone} within range. That creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it must expend all of its movement to stand up instead of half, and takes {@damage 2d4} force damage. On a success, it takes half as much damage and takes no extra movement to stand up.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Heavy Punch
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. If the target hits a creature or object during this movement, both it and the creature or object it hits take {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial force damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Magnetic Beam
entries: Choose a point within range. A line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide of magnetic energy manifests horizontally from that point.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is pulled up to 15 feet along the line in a direction of your choice, and takes {@damage 3d8} force damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.
On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use your action to move the line up to 30 feet within range, and rotate it horizontally.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Rearrange
entries: Choose up to 3 creatures or objects you can see within range. Each target is pulled up to 20 feet in a direction of your choice within range. An unwilling creature that succeeds on a Constitution saving throw is unaffected.

spell.name: Crushing Sphere
entries: You create a 20 foot diameter sphere of gravitational energy at a point you can see within range. Each creature in the sphere must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d8} force damage and is pulled up to 10 feet towards the center of the sphere. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't moved.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Shape Gravity
entries: You shape gravity around a creature you can see within range, attempting to pull it in all directions simultaneously. The creature must make a Constitutions saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d6} force damage and is thrown up to 20 feet in a random direction. Roll a {@dice d4} for the direction: 1, north; 2, south; 3, east; or 4, west. If the target failes its saving throw by 5 or more, you can choose the direction instead, and you can choose for the direction to be directly up. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't thrown.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Chasm

m.text: 5 pounds of stone from at least 30 feet beneath the ground which the spell consumes

entries: You rip open a 30 foot long 10 foot wide 30 foot deep chasm through the ground within range. Any creature, object, or structure on the ground directly above the chasm falls into the chasm if it can fit and there is nothing else holding it aloft.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the length of the chasm increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Low Gravity

components.m: the tail feather of a roc

entries: Gravity is lowered in a 60 foot cube originating from a point within range. Ranged weapon attacks made by or against a target in the cube have disadvantage. When a creature within the cube falls, it descends at a rate of 60 feet per round and takes no falling damage. Whenever a creature with no flying speed in the cube willingly moves, or falls {@condition prone}, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be pulled up to the top of the cube where it can't move until the end of the turn, at which point it falls. When a creature fails its saving throw against this spell, you can use your reaction to have it succeed instead.

spell.name: Black Hole
entries: Choose a point you can see within range. A small bead of condensed gravitational energy forms at that point. At the end of your turn, the bead explodes out into a spherical black hole of a radius of your choice from 5 feet up to 60 feet.

All earth, structures, and nonmagical objects that are not being worn or carried within the black hole are instantly torn apart and disintegrated. Each creature in the black hole must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature that fails its save is pulled as far as it can be towards the center of the black hole, and takes {@damage 6d10} force damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.
If this spell reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is instantly killed and its body is torn apart and disintegrated.

item.name: Arm Bands of Force
entries: While wearing these arm bands, your unarmed attacks deal force damage instead of the normal bludgeoning. When you score a critical hit with an unarmed attack against a creature, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 5 feet away from you, or knocked {@condition prone} (your choice).

item.name: Etherial Grappling Hook
entries: As as action while holding this hook, you can choose a point you can see within 30 feet of you. A magical rope connects from your spot to that point, unless there is something obstructing the path, such as a wall or creature. The magical rope remains for 1 minute, and this action can't be used while it remains. A creature that is touching the magical rope can move along it as if it were climbing.

item.name: Explorer's Hat
entries: This hat fits perfectly to the wearer's head, and can't be unwillingly removed from their head. It blows in the wind as if about to fall off, but always remains on.

item.name: Gem of Plant Growth
entries: This green gemstone glows with magical energy. While attuned to it, you can cast {@spell plant growth}. Once you cast this spell this way, it can't be cast this way again for 7 days.

item.name: Gravity Bomb
entries: This small brown orb feels much heavier than it looks. As an action, a creature holding this orb can throw it up to 60 feet. The object shatters at the end of this throw, and creatures within 10 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw, or fall {@condition prone}

item.name: Levitating Chair
entries: While touching this chair, you can speak its command word to cause it to levitate up to 10 feet in the air. While in the air, a creature touching this chair can use its action to push or pull the chair up to 10 feet horizontally. It remains in the air for 1 minute, or until you speaks its command word again.

item.name: Ring of Orbit
entries: As an action, you can rub this ring to activate it and create a gravitational pull towards you. Each other creature within 30 feet of you must succeed a DC 15 Strength saving throw, or be pulled up to 30 feet directly towards you. Until the start of your next turn, creatures within 30 feet of you can't willingly move more than 30 feet away from you.
Once this ring has been activated, it can't be activated again until the next dawn.

item.name: Staff of Gravity
entries: This wooden staff weighs only 1 pound, but holds the force of gravity within in. It can be used as a quarterstaff that deals force damage instead of the normal bludgeoning. While attuned to this staff you gain the following benefits

items: It only takes 5 feet of your movement to stand from {@condition prone}
Once on each turn, when you deal force damage to a creature, you can reroll one of the dice and use either result of your choice.

item.name: Wand of Weightlessness
entries: This wand has 4 charges. While holding the wand, you can spend charges to cast the following spells, 1 charge to cast feather fall, 2 charges to cast levitate, and 3 charges to cast rearrange, with a spell save DC of 15.
The wand regains {@dice 1d4} charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Wand of Weight
entries: This wand has 4 charges. While holding this wand, you can spend charges to cast the following spells, 1 charge to cast intensify gravity, 2 charges to cast root, adn 3 charges to cast heavy punch, with a spell save DC of 15 and spell attack modifier of +7.
The wand regains {@dice 1d4} charges daily at dawn.

trait.name: Force Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Gravity Aura
entries: Whenever a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the elemental, it can force that creature to make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the elemental chooses to either knock the creature {@condition prone}, or pull it up to 10 feet towards the elemental. If a creature starts its turn in the elemental's space, it automatically fails the saving throw.

trait.name: Unstable Force
entries: Whenever the elemental would take force damage, or it takes at least 20 damage in a single turn, it can use its reaction to let loose an unstable force. Each other creature within 30 feet of the elemental must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) force damage. The elemental can then fly up to half its flying speed. If a creature is in the elemental's space, it automatically fails the saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) force damage.

action.name: Crush {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature in the elemental's space must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) force damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Force Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Pushing Force
entries: When a creature starts its turn in the elementals space, the elemental can force that creature to make a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw, being pushed up to 5 feet away from the elemental on a failed save.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) force damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragons fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Enrage
entries: When the dragon is reduced to half its hit point maximum or lower, it immediately regains its gravity breath and all its legendary actions. Each creature that can see or hear the dragon loses immunity to its Frightful Presence until it succeeds against it again.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 ft. of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a

{@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Gravity Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon chooses a point within 5 feet of its mouth. A well of gravity bursts out from the point. Each creature within 30 feet of the point must make a

{@dc 19} Strength saving throw. A creature that fails its save takes 54 ({@damage 12d8}) force damage and is pulled up to 30 feet towards the point. A creature takes half as much damage and suffers no additional effects on a successful save.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 ft. of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

monster.name: Magnet Golem

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Magnetic
entries: All metal objects within 10 feet of the golem that aren't being worn or carried are pulled to it and become stuck to it. When the golem is hit by a melee weapon attack with a metal weapon, the attaker must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or have the weapon become stuck to the golem.
A creature within 5 feet of the golem can use its action to make a {@dc 18} Strength check to remove one object stuck to the golem.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The giant has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Heavy Presence
entries: The giant can move through the space of any creature that is size Medium or smaller. If the giant ends its turn in another creatures space, that creature is pushed 5 feet away from the giant and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Climber
entries: The goblin can climb with one hand free, and climbing imposes no drawback on its ability to make weapon attacks.

trait.name: Rough and Tumble
entries: The summit goblin can make a grapple or shove attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The goblin has advantage on saving throws against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}, and ignores fall damage from falls of 30 feet or less.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Climber
entries: The goblin can climb with one hand free, and climbing imposes no drawback on its ability to make weapon attacks.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The goblin has advantage on saving throws against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}, and ignores fall damage from falls of 30 feet or less.

trait.name: Commander
entries: The goblin can use a bonus action to shout out a command. Each creature of its choice within 30 feet of it that can hear it can use its reaction to move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks. If the summit goblin captain is below half its hit point maximum, each of these creature can use its reaction to make one weapon attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The goblin makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

entries.name: Gravitational Elemental
entries: Gravitational Elementals are the physical embodiment of pure magical gravity. They resemble a flickering cloud of brown colored electricity. Unlike other elementals, they don't shape themselves into humanoid forms, or even the form of any normal creature. They remain a buzzing cloud of gravitational energy.
Being neutral creatures of nature, they don't normally attack unless provoked. Not un-often though they will be captured and used as weapons by nefarious folk.

entries.name: Gravity Spec
entries: A gravity spec is a tiny elemental manifestation of gravitational energy. They look like their larger counterparts, but have only a fraction of their force. Purveyors of magic often like to capture them in jars and wear them as a sort of trinket and study item.

entries.name: Gravity Dragon
entries: While technically chromatic, gravity dragons are a sandy brown color with hard rock-like scales. Wielding the power of gravitational energy, they can alter gravity with a roar alone.

These dragons love treasure, specifically magical items and locations. They often make their lairs in places of high magical energy. This makes the Peaks of Gravity the perfect home for them to dwell. They care not for ruling over others as some of their chromatic counterparts do, but love hunting and imposing their presence on those weaker than them.

Unlike most other dragons, these large creatures are willing to bargain and trade for treasures as long as they think they are getting the better deal. If caught trying to swindle or trick a gravity dragon, you will soon realize its power over the forces of natures and why they are named as such.

entries.name: A Gravity Dragon's Lair
entries: Gravity dragons love areas of highly concentrated magical energy. Somewhere already saturated in gravitational energy is perfect for them, though with enough time their presence can alter the natural gravity of a lair anywhere.
Gravity shifts and alters from instant to instant in their liar. The entrance especially will have high gravity that cripples the weak as they enter.

entries.name: Magnet Golem
entries: Magnet golems are a rare type of golem made of pure magnetic metals.

entries.name: Mountain Giant
entries: Mountain giant are a race of giants that wander the lower regions of the Peaks of Gravity and other mountain ranges. They are generally considered slightly more civilized than hill giants, but still not as much as other giants.

Goblins that live on the Peaks of Gravity have established their own tribes and ways of life to accommodate for the mountainous conditions. The locals refer to them as summit goblins, though they are rarely found at any real summit. They usually settle in the mid to lower regions of the mountains, as there are more travelers and beasts to hunt at such elevations. As I mapped the lower regions of the mountains, I often found small summit goblin camps in caves and ridges short distances off from known trails.

These goblin folk seem to have similar nature to goblins found elsewhere, but when come in contact with, they are noticeably stronger and heartier. Their ability to climb and strike from above allows them to set dangerous ambushes and hide on cliff sides waiting for unknowing travelers to pass by.

Though I never came in contact with any, other common goblinoids and humanoids are known to have summit counterparts. A bugbear or hobgoblin with the climber or sure-footed trait is sure to be found if one were to travel higher through these mountains.

legendaryGroup.name: Gravity Dragon
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Each other creature in the lair has its flying speed reduced to 0 until the next lair action.
A 20-foot cube of heavy gravity manifests at a point of the dragons choosing. Each creature in the cube must succeed a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

Gravity in the lair lowers drastically. Each creature that doesn't have a flying speed floats up to 15 feet off the ground until the next lair action. A creature floating this way can propel itself through the air to move as if climbing.

regionalEffects: The moonlet of Atropus is a barren, unforgiving wasteland of dread and despair, littered with undead, star spawn aberrations, and debris picked up from the countless worlds it annihilated. The following effects take place on and within 60 feet of the moonlet:

items: The moonlet remains on the dark side of the world, keeping the planet between it and the sun. As such, the moonlet is in total darkness.
The moonlet has a thin atmosphere permeated by a field of negative energy. It is not breathable, and creatures that suffocate in it are overwhelmed by the stench of rotting flesh.

Due to the moonlet's low gravity, creatures have their walking speed increased by 5 feet, only take {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet they fall, and have their carrying capacities doubled.

Creatures take 1 necrotic damage for each minute that they spend on the moonlet. This damage cannot be reduced by resistance to necrotic damage. Constructs, star spawn, and undead are immune to this effect.

A creature that isn't a construct, star spawn, or undead that reaches 0 hit points dies instantly, rising as a {@creature zombie} after 1 minute if nothing raises it beforehand. Such a creature cannot be restored to life by any means.
The amount of hit points restored by magical healing is halved.
Spells and effects that attempt to restore life to dead creatures have no effect.
Spells that raise undead can animate or target twice as many creatures and take effect for twice their normal duration.

feat.name: Gravitational Spell Adept
entries: You learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@book gravitational spell list|TTAtPoG|7}.
In addition, choose 2 1st-level spells from the {@book gravitational spell list|TTAtPoG|7}.

You can cast one of the chosen spells once, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast either in this way again. The level at which it is cast is equal to your level divided by 6 (rounded up).
Your spellcasting ability for these spells is either Charisma, Wisdom, or Intelligence (your choice).

feat.name: Mountaineer
entries: You have mastered the art of mountaineering and climbing.

items: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.
You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws to avoid falling or being knocked {@condition prone}.
You ignore the first 30 feet of a fall when determining falling damage.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
entries: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Survival}

items.name: Languages
entries: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
entries: {@item Navigator's tools|phb}, a {@item backpack|phb}, 2 {@item torch|phb|torches}, and a {@item pouch|phb} containing 15 gp

entries.name: Life in the Peaks
entries: What brought you to the Peaks of Gravity? You can work with your GM to determine the exact characteristics of your life within the mountain range, or roll on the table below.

rows: I was born and raised in Rigi.
I came here on a pilgrimage and decided to stay, living in the mountains.
I was lost as a child within the range.
I choose to live in a place of immense natural magical energy.
I feel pulled to the location and feel safest here.
I moved to Rigi.
I stay here to study the magic of the location.
Living in the mountains allows me to stay away from those I don't want to see.

entries.name: Feature: Known Direction
entries: You are used to travel through harsh terrain. While in a place where north exists, you always know the direction of north.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Those that spend so much time in the mountains often find enjoyment from some aspect of it. Pick one or two reasons, or roll on the table below.

rows: Being above the clouds is the only real way to connect with nature.
Looking down at the world makes me realize how small I really am.
I love the chill of cold mountain air.
The immediate danger of falling is the thrill I love.
The accomplishment of climbing to a summit drives me to keep moving.
I prefer to stay out of societies way and in unexplored terrain.
I climb to search for lost treasure and undiscovered secrets.
Jumping from great heights is the payoff for a hard climb.

entries: The Peaks of Gravity are home to the small summit town of Rigi as well as scattered travelers and vagabonds. You are of them, either growing up in Rigi, or moving to the Peaks of Gravity later in life. Due to your extended time in the region, you have become accustomed to life here and gained specific abilities.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Gravitation
entries: Druids of the Circle of Gravitation seek to protect not just nature, but the very forces of nature that they draw their power from. They hone their druidic magic focusing in on manipulation of gravitational forces, being able to alter it within creatures and the world.

When druids of this circle gather, it is at places of great influence over nature's forces. This can range from an area heavily saturated with magical energy, to naturally prominent areas such as fault lines, mountain ranges, or even magnetic poles of the planet.

subclassFeature.name: Gravity Spells
entries: At 2nd level, your connection to natural forces of the world allows you facility with unique spells. Spells that appear on the {@book gravitational spell list|TTAtPoG|7} that don't appear on the druid spell list are added to the druid spell list for you, and you learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@book gravitational spell list|TTAtPoG|7}.

In addition, when you prepare spells at the end of a long rest, you can prepare one additional spell that must appear on the {@book gravitational spell list|TTAtPoG|7}. The number of additional spells you can prepare this way increases to 2 at 6th level, and 3 at 10th level.

subclassFeature.name: Well of Gravity
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can alter the gravity of creatures affected by your magic. Once per turn, when one of your spells or abilities causes a creature to be moved, you can cause that creature to be moved up to an additional 5 feet in the same direction. When you move a creature this way, you can also choose to deal {@dice 1d6} force damage to it.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to 2 + you Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Internal Pull
entries: Finally starting at 2nd level, as an action, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape feature to gain complete control of gravity around you, immediately pushing creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you up to 5 feet away from you. While this feature is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: When an attack is made against you, you can use your reaction to give the attack disadvantage, as you weigh it down with gravity.
When you use your Well of Gravity feature, you can either double the additional distance the creature is moved, or double the force damage it deals to the creature.
You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed, but can't use it to fly more than 5 feet above the ground.
As a reaction to being moved against your will, you can choose to not be moved instead.

entries: These benefits last for 10 minutes, until you are {@condition incapacitated}, or until you use your Wild Shape again.

subclassFeature.name: Limitless
entries: Beginning at 6th level, the additional distance you can move a creature with your Well of Gravity feature increases to 10 feet. In addition, when you use it to move a willing creature, you can do so without expending a use of it, even if you have no uses remaining.

subclassFeature.name: Elevate
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you deal force damage to a creature with your Well of Gravity feature, you can roll an additional {@dice 1d6} and add it to the result.

In addition, while your Internal Pull feature is active, your speed increases by 5 feet, your flying speed has no restriction on the distance you can fly above the ground, and you no longer have to use your reaction to give weapon attacks against you disadvantage if you can see the attacker.

subclassFeature.name: Profundity
entries: At 14th level, you gain full capacity with gravitational spells. You can cast a spell of 1st level or higher that appears on the gravitation spell list without expending a spell slot, even if you don't have that spell prepared. To be eligible, the spell must be of 5th level or lower. When you cast a spell this way, it is cast as if you used a 5th level spell slot to cast it.
Once you cast a spell this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Gravity Knight
entries: Giant celestial bodies spiral throughout the multiverse. When two of these bodies come within close proximity, they begin to orbit one another due to gravitational energy. There is immense gravitational energy between them that can cause tides and even be used magically. Gravity knights are able to tap into this energy and harness a small bit of it to alter gravity around them.

subclassFeature.name: Celestial Exploit
entries: Starting when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you are able to harness and alter the gravitational energy of celestial masses orbiting your planet to preform celestial exploits. To use an exploit, you must use your bonus action and choose one of the following abilities to preform.

entries.name: Crushing Strike
entries: You bolster the gravitational force of your blows. The next time you take the {@action Attack} action this turn, you gain a bonus {@dice 1d6} to weapon attack rolls you make as part of that action. This die changes to {@dice 1d8} at 10th level and {@dice 1d10} at 18th level.

entries.name: Gravitational Block
entries: You wrap a small piece of gravitational energy around yourself in hopes to weigh down oncoming attacks. Roll {@dice 1d6}, until the start of your next turn, you gain a bonus to your AC equal to the number rolled. This die changes to {@dice 1d8} at 10th level and, {@dice 1d10} at 18th level.

entries.name: Light Footing
entries: You lighten your own gravitation pull. Until the start of your next turn, you gain a 20 foot bonus to your speed and have advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws. The bonus to your movement speed increases to 30 feet at 10th level and 40 feet at 18th level.
You can use this feature two times. You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest. Starting at 7th level, you can use it three times between rests.

subclassFeature.name: Lower
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell feather fall} spell once without providing material components. You regain the ability to do so again after you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

subclassFeature.name: Lift
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your connection to gravitational forces takes some weight off your shoulders. You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

subclassFeature.name: Passive Exploit
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you roll initiative and have no uses of Celestial Exploit remaining, you regain 1 use.

subclassFeature.name: Light Swing
entries: Starting at 15th level, once per turn, when you take the {@action Attack} action and hit a single creature with two weapon attacks as part of that action, you can make an additional weapon attack as part of the same action.

subclassFeature.name: Force of Gravity
entries: Starting at 18th level, your blows drop crushing weight onto your foes. When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can choose to imbue your attacks with extra forces of gravity. If you do so, weapon attacks you make as part of that action deal an additional {@dice 1d10} force damage and reduce the target's movement speed by 5 feet until the end of its next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Way of Gravitation
entries: Monks of the Way of Gravitation harness the very power of gravity. They have meditated on this natural force to be able to tap their ki into it and alter gravitation around them. They often see gravity not only as a force of nature, but as an extension of their arts.

subclassFeature.name: Gravitational Punches
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, your blows are so heavy that they reform gravity around them. You gain the following benefits to your Flurry of Blows.

items: Whenever hit two different creatures with the unarmed strikes granted by your Flurry of Blows, you can create a gravitational pull between the two creatures. Until the end of your next turn, the creatures can't willingly move while more than 20 feet away from each other, unless they are moving closer together.

Whenever you hit the same creature with both of the unarmed strikes granted by your Flurry of Blows, you can create a vortex of high gravity within it, halving its speed until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Light as a Feather
entries: Also at 3rd level, you gain the ability to reduce your own gravity. When you're {@condition prone}, you can stand up by spending 5 feet of movement, rather than half your speed.

subclassFeature.name: Fluctuate
entries: At 6th level, you gain the following abilities.

entries.name: Catch
entries: You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell feather fall} without providing material components.

entries.name: Heavy Stance
entries: As a reaction to being forcibly moved, you can increase your gravity and not be moved instead.

subclassFeature.name: Low Gravity
entries: Beginning at 11th level, when you use your Step of the Wind feature, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your turn.
In addition, when you affect a creature with your Gravitational Punches feature, it takes force damage equal to your Martial Arts die.

subclassFeature.name: Plummet
entries: Beginning at 17th level, once per turn, when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 3 ki points to attempt to change the creature's gravitational pull. The creature's gravity is changed and it begins to fall in any direction of your choice. The creature must make a Strength saving throw against your Ki save DC. On a failed save, the creature falls up to 60 feet in the chosen direction. On a successful save, it falls up to 30 feet in the chosen direction. In either case, if a solid object is encountered in this fall, the creature strikes it just as it would during a normal downward fall. The creature's gravity returns to normal after the fall or after it collides with anything.

subclassFeature.name: Gravitational Origin
entries: Some are born with innate power of forces of gravity. This could be due to the location of birth, being in contact with powerful gravitational waves, or other powerful force of nature. Whatever the case, sorcerers of this origin inherently command the force of gravity and bend it to their will.

subclassFeature.name: Innate Spells
entries: Starting when you choose this origin at 1st level, you have a knack for gravitational magic. Spells that appear on the {@book gravitational spell list|TTAtPoG|7} that don't appear on the sorcerer spell list are added to the sorcerer spell list for you.

In addition, you learn one 1st level spell of your choice that appears on the {@book gravitational spell list|TTAtPoG|7}. This spell doesn't count against your number of spells known. You learn an additional spell of 1st level or higher of your choice that appears on the {@book gravitational spell list|TTAtPoG|7} at 3rd level, and again at 5th, 7th and 9th level. These spells don't count against your number of spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Raise/Lower
entries: Also starting at 1st level, you can instinctively alter gravity around yourself. As a bonus action on your turn, you can lower or raise your gravity, gaining one the following benefits.

entries.name: Lower
entries: You gain a flying speed equal to half your walking speed until the end of your turn. If you already have a flying speed, you instead gain a bonus to your flying speed equal to half your walking speed until the end of your turn.

entries.name: Raise
entries: The next time you make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw before the start of your next turn, you can roll {@dice 1d6} and add it to the result.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to 1 + your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Pull Your Weight
entries: Beginning at 6th level, as a reaction to a creature being moved by one of your spells, you can spend 1 sorcery point to fly up to your speed directly towards that creature without provoking opportunity attacks.

In addition, when you use your Raise/Lower feature, you can spend up to 3 sorcery points. For each sorcery point you spend this way, you can grant the same benefit to another creature you can see until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Gravity Field
entries: At 14th level, you learn to create protective fields of gravity around yourself. Whenever you finish a short or long rest, you gain temporary hit points equal to your sorcerer level. While you have these hit points, you have a 10 foot flying speed.

subclassFeature.name: Heavy Crush
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can force heavy gravity upon your enemies. As an action, you can spend 5 sorcery points to create extreme heavy gravity around any number of creatures of your choice within 60 feet of you. Each chosen creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. A creature that fails its saving throw is knocked {@condition prone}, takes {@dice 2d10} force damage, and until the start of your next turn has a flying speed of 0, and has disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws and on all attacks. A creature that succeeds its saving throw takes half as much damage and suffers no other effects.

subclassFeature.name: School of Gravity
entries: These wizards are dedicated to the study of gravitational magic. This magic is focused on battlefield control and manipulation of the movement of others. Though it doesn't come through ritual or meditation as it does to most, they wield gravitational magic with as much force as any other. To them, it is a unique force of the universe to tap into and understand.

subclassFeature.name: Gravity Savant
entries: When you choose this arcane tradition at 2nd level, spells that appear on the {@book gravitational spell list|TTAtPoG|7} that don't appear on the wizard spell list are added to the wizard spell list for you, and you learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@book gravitational spell list|TTAtPoG|7}. This cantrip doesn't count against your number of cantrips known.
In addition, the gold and time you must spend to copy a spell that appears on the {@book gravitational spell list|TTAtPoG|7} into your spellbook is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Control
entries: Beginning at 2nd level, you have learned to control objects internal gravity. As an action, you can touch an object and either double its weight, or halve its weight. The object's weight remains altered for 8 hours. You can have a number of objects altered this way up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). If you try alter an object while you already have your maximum number altered, one of the object's of your choice returns to its normal weight.

You can also alter the weight of creatures. As an action, you can touch a creature and either double its speed, or halve its speed until the end of its next turn. Once you affect a creature this way, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Unrestricted Weight
entries: At 6th level, you add the {@spell fly} spell to your spellbook if it is not there already. If it is already in your spellbook, you can instead add a wizard spell of your choice of 1st, 2nd, or 3rd level to your spellbook. When you cast {@spell fly} you can target 1 additional creature.

subclassFeature.name: Boost of Gravity
entries: Beginning at 10th level, when you cast a spell that appears on the gravitational spell list using a spell slot, you can cast it one level higher than the spell slot expended. You can do so a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Double Target
entries: Starting at 14th level you have mastered the local manipulation of gravity. When you cast a spell that appears on the gravitational spell list that targets at least 1 creature, you can target 1 additional valid creature within range. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Age
entries: Thrush reach maturity by age 3, and can easily live up to 60 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most thrush are good, and lean towards a lawful nature. They usually enjoy freedom, and moving, but still uphold laws over chaos.

entries.name: Size
entries: Thrush grow to just above 5 feet tall at maturity. They have thin bodies, but can look much larger behind their feathers. Thrush that neglect flying can become heavier. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Glide
entries: You can use your action extend your wings and gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your turn. At the end of your turn, you fall if you are still aloft, unless you can stop the fall.
When you fall and you are conscious, you take no falling damage and do not land {@condition prone} due to the fall.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Aarakocra, and Auran.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Thrush
entries: Thrush, otherwise known as summit aarakocra, are be birdlike humanoids with large wingspans of flowing feathers with taloned claws at the ends. They are majestic brightly colored and feathered creatures that are proud to be what they are. Traditionally they life high up in the mountains and create cities of nests spiraling up summit peaks.

entries.name: Distant Cousins
entries: The ancestors of the thrush, known commonly as birdfolk, have various origins across different worlds. In some, they came from the Elemental Plane of Air, in others they were born of more natural ways. Regardless of their origin, divides among the ancient birdfolk gave birth to both the thrush and aarakocra species, each having their own unique characteristics and cultures. This divide is due to mainly thrush living for generations in their own mountaintop societies isolated from other humanoids.

entries.name: Mountainous Origins
entries: Thrush have lived for generations only high up in mountainous regions. Living in this harsh environment for generations with only open air around the peaks has altered thrush to have no need for long distance flying, only short bursts to get from peak to peak and glide through the mountainous terrain. Their arms and wings are not separate appendages, but one in the same, with clawed hands at the end.

entries.name: Thrush Names
entries: Thrush share the same language and naming culture as aarakocra. Their names include clicks, trills, and whistles. Typically, a name has two to four syllables with the sounds acting as connectors. When interacting with other races, they may use nicknames gained from people they meet or shortened forms of their full names.

items.name: Male Midlander Names
items.entry: Aera, Aial, Aur, Deekek, Ekkar, Errk, Heehk, Ikki, Irek, Kleeccahk, Oorr, Qi, Ouss, Quaf, Quierk, Rhekirk, Salleek, Sarc, Urreek, Zeed

entries: Thrush are a kind and curious bunch. You'll see many young thrush diving from high ridges and gliding down through the air, even diving into lakes or ponds for personal fishing. They are one of the only humanoid races I found that seems to be native to the Peaks of Gravity, though they have migrated out and can be found living almost anywhere in the world.
